conclusion: Consider direction and angle of light relative to objects to determine shadow changes.
Light source currently positioned such that shadows are cast to the left and slightly forward of objects.
Light source moves to the back right, changing direction of light rays.
Shadows will shift to the opposite side relative to new light direction, moving towards front left of objects.
Size of shadows may change depending on light angle; lower angle results in longer shadows, more vertical results in shorter shadows.
Object A's shadow will move to front left and may become longer if light angle is lower.
Object B's shadow will move to front left and may change in size similarly to Object A.
Object C's shadow will shift to front left; size may change depending on light angle, shape might distort due to transparency and refraction.
Object D's shadow will move to front left and may elongate if light is at a lower angle.
All shadows will shift towards the front left; size may increase if light source is at a lower angle, making shadows longer.
